revised_title: Investigating Congenital Night-Blindness and its Impact on Color Perception
tldr: This article discusses two cases of congenital night-blindness and examines their vision, particularly their color perception. The author compares the night-blind individuals' perception of colors and light with that of normal vision, and suggests that the difference in perception is due to the absence of sensitive rods in the retina of night-blind individuals. The study provides insights into the genetic and physiological aspects of night-blindness and its impact on color vision.
